title: Dynamic genre checkbox selector + fixed watchlist row layout + global black/gold theme

requirements.text: In the Add Manga dialog, keep the existing manual genre entry (comma-separated) and add an additional organized, dynamic checkbox list of genres that already exist in the user’s library, so the user can select genres without retyping them.

quotes: on top of the ability to add the genres manually, also include an organized dynamic checkbox that list genres that already exist so i don't have to keep tying them every time.

acceptanceCriteria: The Add Manga dialog still supports typing genres manually as comma-separated text.
The dialog shows a checkbox list of existing genres derived from the current user’s existing manga entries.
Checking/unchecking genres updates the genres that will be saved for the new manga entry (combined with any manually entered genres, with duplicates removed).
The checkbox list is organized (e.g., sorted alphabetically) and remains usable when there are many genres (scrollable area).

requirements.text: Update the watchlist entry UI to use a fixed-size row layout: each entry must be 78px tall and 900px wide, must not shrink/compress, must have a black background, and must have a glowing gold outline.

quotes: limit the watchlist height to 78 pixels in height and make the watchlist width 900 pixels and unable to be compressed.
give the watchlist a glowing gold outline with black background.

acceptanceCriteria: Each watchlist item renders as a horizontal row with height exactly 78px.
Each watchlist item renders at width exactly 900px and does not shrink when placed in flex/grid layouts (e.g., uses no-shrink behavior).
Each watchlist item has a black background and a visible gold outline with a glow effect.

requirements.text: Within each watchlist row, place the cover picture flush to the left edge with a display area no more than 35px wide, and place the title immediately to the right of the cover with a display area no more than 250px wide.

quotes: put the cover picture on the left edge of the watchlist, with the display area being no more than 35 pixels in width.
and right next to that cover display is the title, making the display area no more than 250 pixels in width.

acceptanceCriteria: The cover image column is anchored to the far left of the row and is constrained to <= 35px width.
The title is placed immediately to the right of the cover column and is constrained to <= 250px width (with truncation/ellipsis if needed).
The layout remains stable and aligned across all watchlist items.

requirements.text: Hide alternate titles in the watchlist item display (do not render alternate titles anywhere in the watchlist entry UI).
acceptanceCriteria: Alternate titles are not visible in the watchlist UI even if they exist in the data.

requirements.text: Apply a global visual theme update so that all app backgrounds and all dropdown menus/popups (e.g., dialogs, selects/popovers) use a black background with a gold outline going forward.

quotes: give all backgrounds/dropdown menus/popups back background with gold outline from here on out.

acceptanceCriteria: Primary page backgrounds render as black.
Dialogs/popovers/dropdown menus render with black backgrounds and gold outlines (without editing read-only UI component sources).
Borders/outlines across the UI reflect gold styling consistently (including focus rings where applicable).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose/override styling via props, wrappers, and global CSS variables instead).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend methods if strictly necessary.
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication providers or change Internet Identity behavior.
Do not add new backend services or external databases.
Do not change pagination behavior or page size unless required for the watchlist row layout.
